Sequence Information.Peptide Name: TsAP-S1 (Lys-rich; synthetic AMPs20; XXA, UCLL1c; TsAP-1: inactive)
Sequence Information.Source: The inactive natural peptide TsAP-1 was made active by increasing 4 lysines and one leucine, template-based design

Literature Information.Literature: Highly active against S. aureus (MIC 2.5 uM), E. coli (MIC 5 uM) and C. albicans (MIC 2.5 uM). The increase in both basic and hydrophobic amino acids made this peptide more active against pathogens and more toxic to mammalian cells.  Also anticancer: IC50 values of 1.5 uM (H157), 1.6 uM (H838), 1.8 uM (MCF-7), 2.1 uM (PC3) and 2.9 uM (U251-MG).Toxicity: complete hemolysis at 20 uM. Hence,highly hemolytic. The original entry for the natural parent peptide TsAP-1 (seq: FLSLIPSLVGGSISAFK) was replaced with its active analog in 11/2021. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Guo X, Ma C, Du Q, Wei R, Wang L, Zhou M, Chen T, Shaw C.2013
Literature Information.Title: Two peptides, TsAP-1 and TsAP-2, from the venom of the Brazilian yellow scorpion, Tityus serrulatus: evaluation of their antimicrobial and anticancer activities
